definition[0]: to do something as a way of ending an event, performance etc in a suitable or satisfactory way
example[0]: It was the perfect way to round off the season.
example[1]: You can round off the evening with a visit to the nightclub.
example[2]: She rounded off the meal with some cheese.
definition[1]: to take the sharp or rough edges off something
example[3]: Round off the corners with a pair of scissors.
definition[2]: to change an exact figure to the nearest whole number
example[4]: Prices are rounded off to the nearest dollar.
